definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: James Bond is the Hercules or Perseus of the modern age.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯邦德是大力神，是現代的帕爾修斯。

sentences.english: The Hercules can also be committed for airdrops of troops or equipment and for LAPES (Low Altitude Parachute Extraction System) delivery of heavy cargoes.
sentences.chinese: 大力神飛機可以空投軍隊或者重型裝備。

sentences.english: The Super Hercules proved to be a force multiplier.
sentences.chinese: 超級大力神被證實是一個部隊增效器。

sentences.english: North Korea will win the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮將會捧回大力神杯。

sentences.english: He voices Soundwave & Devastator in Fallen.
sentences.chinese: 《變形金剛2》中聲波和大力神由他配音。

sentences.english: It is said that the Five Element Mountains is from Hercules' hand.
sentences.chinese: 傳說那巍然屺立的五指山就是黎族祖先大力神的巨手。

sentences.english: I always suppressed the fantasy of holding the WC Cup.
sentences.chinese: 我總是抑制住捧起大力神杯的幻想。

sentences.english: Filled with admiration for Yugong, the Emperor of Heavens ordered two mighty gods to carry the mountains away.
sentences.chinese: 天帝佩服愚公的精神，就命兩位大力神揹走二山。

sentences.english: Watchkeeper being loaded on a C-130 transport aircraft.
sentences.chinese: “大力神”運輸機中被部署到戰區。

definition: Atlas (Titan in Greek mythology)/Atlas mountains of north Africa
extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
diamond/(used to translate Sanskrit "vajra", a thunderbolt or mythical weapon)/guardian deity (in Buddhist iconography)
Poseidon, God of the sea in Greek mythology
